note.p: Death: At his lodgings in Serjeant's Inn, London (18 September 1817)
Burial: St Bride's, Fleet Street, London
Education: Dumfries and Edinburgh, Scotland. MD (1780, Edinburgh); LCP (1788)

Career: Apprenticed to Dr Alexander Garden (FRS 1773) in Charleston (1771); went to London, then Edinburgh (1775); Surgeon to a Scots regiment in the Service of the United Provinces (1779); resigned his commission after arguing with his commanding officer; volunteer, printer, bookseller and merchant, South Carolina (1780-1784); became friendly with Matthew Baillie in London, and set up practice (1784); Physician, St Thomas's Hospital, London (1795-1817)
References: C F A Pantin, 'Alfred Russel Wallace, FRS, and His Essays of 1858 and 1855' in NR 1959 vol 14 pp 67-84
F Kurzer, 'The life and work of Charles Tomlinson FRS: A Career in Victorian Science and Technology' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 203-226
